meanings.sent1: The highlanders enjoyed the fresh air and stunning views of their mountain home.
meanings.sent2: The highlanders built their homes on the slopes of the tall mountains.
meanings.sent3: The highlanders organized a picnic at the peak of the mountain, enjoying the scenic beauty.
meanings.sent4: The highlanders were like eagles, perched high above the world.
meanings.sent5: The highlanders' village nestled among the craggy peaks, a hidden gem in the mountains.

meanings.sent1: The highlanders marched proudly in their traditional kilts, ready for battle.
meanings.sent2: The highlanders trained rigorously in the art of warfare in the rugged Highlands.
meanings.sent3: The highlanders joked about their battle skills over a hearty meal in the barracks.
meanings.sent4: The highlanders' courage was as unyielding as the ancient mountains they hailed from.
meanings.sent5: The highlanders' bagpipes echoed through the misty Highlands, a call to arms.

meanings.definition: People who live in high altitudes
meanings.sent1: The highlanders acclimated well to the thin air of the high mountains.
meanings.sent2: The highlanders trekked through the snowy peaks, their lungs accustomed to the altitude.
meanings.sent3: The highlanders joked about needing extra oxygen tanks for their mountain adventures.
meanings.sent4: The highlanders' resilience at high altitudes was unmatched, like mountain goats.
meanings.sent5: The highlanders' endurance races up the steep slopes amazed all who watched.
